, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Speed reading can be\ndone by people with mylenin sheaths in perfect condition. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/02/speed-reading-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/02/speed-reading-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Encephalitis is an\ninflammatory condition of the brain with many etiologies. There are several\ntypes of encephalitis that are immune-mediated, including the classic\nparaneoplastic encephalitis syndromes and the encephalitis syndromes associated\nwith antibodies against neuronal cell surface/synaptic proteins. The latter are\noften referred to as autoimmune encephalitis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Encephalitis is usually\na primary manifestation or a secondary (postinfectious) immunologic\ncomplication of viral infection.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nViruses causing primary encephalitis directly invade the brain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the US, the most\ncommon sporadic encephalitis is caused by herpes simplex virus&nbsp; (HSV); several thousand cases occur\nyearly.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Most are due to HSV-1, but\nHSV-2 may be more common among immunocompromised patients.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Encephalitis can occur\nas a secondary immunologic complication of certain viral infections or\nvaccinations.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Inflammatory\ndemyelination of the brain and spinal cord can occur 1 to 3 weeks later (as\nacute disseminated encephalomyelitis); the immune system attacks one or more\nCNS antigens that resemble proteins of the infectious agent.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Primary encephalitis\ncan occur as a late consequence of a viral infection. The best known types\nare&nbsp; HIV-associated encephalopathy and\ndementia ( myelin sheaths damaged )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img kasperskylab_antibanner=\"on\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1TmA2Q8dmoI/UwiDv2Fb3eI/AAAAAAAApp4/Gfi3eJL51UI/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3976498159451193962\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_21M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/10/the-bully-reloaded-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html?showComment=1477025470844#c3976498159451193962\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">October 21, 2016 at 10:21 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_21MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nMORE THAN 4.1 BILLION PEOPLE ON THIS PLANET HAVE HERPES SIMPLEX VIRUS TYPE 1 ( HSV -1 ).<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br />88 % OF PEOPLE IN USA HAVE HSV-1 . <br /><br />IN THE WEST MORE THAN 78 % PEOPLE HAVE THIS DISEASE.</span><br />\n<br />\nTHEY HIDE THESE FIGURES -<br />\n<br />\nINDIA IS LEAST AFFECTED BY THIS VIRUS BY PERCENTAGE ON THIS PLANET<br />\n<br />\nHerpes simplex virus is categorized into 2 types: herpes simplex virus type 1 (HSV-1) and herpes simplex virus type 2 (HSV-2). Both HSV-1 and HSV-2 are highly infectious and incurable.<br />\n<br />\nHSV-1 is primarily transmitted by oral-oral contact and in most cases causes orolabial herpes or \u201ccold sores\u201d around the mouth. HSV-1 is also an important cause of genital herpes.<br />\n<br />\nHSV-2 is almost entirely sexually transmitted through skin-to-skin contact, causing genital herpes.<br />\n<br />\nALMOST THE ENTIRE BOLLYWOOD ACTORS/ ACTRESSES HAVE THIS VIRUS --INFECTION FROM FOREIGN DNA IMPORTS<br />\n<br />\nMore than 620 million people on this planet between the ages of 15-50 years have genital infection caused by either HSV-1 or HSV-2.<br />\n<br />\nHerpes is a lifelong infection, which often has mild or no symptoms but can be detected by the presence of antibodies for HSV-1 or HSV-2 in the blood.<br />\n<br />\nWhen genital herpes symptoms do occur, they take the form of one or more painful genital or anal blisters or ulcers<br />\n<br />\nTransmission of HSV most often occurs without symptoms. The virus can have a significant negative impact upon an infected person\u2019s mental wellness and personal relationships.<br />\n<br />\nChildren will often contract HSV-1 from early contact with an infected adult. They then carry the virus with them for the rest of their life.<br />\n<br />\nWHAT IS WHO WORTH ?<br />\n<br />\nWHY DOES A BLOGGER HAVE TO REVEAL THIS?<br />\n<br />\nWHEN I VISITED FOREIGN NATIONS IN THE WEST-- I MADE SURE THAT I ATE FROM DISPOSABLE UTENSILS, AS FAR AS POSSIBLE.<br />\n<br />\nInfection with HSV-1 can happen from general interactions such as eating from the same utensils, or kissing.<br />\n<br />\nJewess Leela Samson introduced kissing in Bollywood.<br />\n<br />\nHSV-2 is contracted through forms of sexual contact with a person who has HSV-2. It is estimated that more than 30% of sexually active adults within the United States have been infected with HSV-2<br />\n<br />\nRisk factors for HSV-2 include:<br />\n<br />\nhaving multiple sex partners<br />\nbeing female<br />\nhaving another sexually transmitted infection (STI)<br />\nhaving a weakened immune system<br />\n<br />\nHSV can also spread to the eyes, causing a condition called herpes keratitis. This can cause symptoms such as eye pain, discharge, and a gritty feeling in the eye.<br />\n<br />\nThere is currently no cure for this virus. Treatment focuses on getting rid of sores and limiting outbreaks.<br />\n<br />\nTODAY INDIANS ARE BEING USED AS GUINEA PIGS FOR EVIL PHARMA DRUGS.<br />\n<br />\nMODI AND ARUN JAITLEY HAVE INTRODUCED 100% FDI IN PHARMA-- WHY ?<br />\n<br />\nWHY IS MODI COMPARING INDIAN ARMY TO ISRAEL ARMY ? WHAT THE FUCK IS ALL THIS?<br />\n<br />\nPeople who become infected with HSV will have the virus for the rest of their lives. Even if it does not manifest symptoms, the virus will continue to live in an infected person\u2019s nerve cells. Some people may experience regular outbreaks.<br />\n<br />\nAn outbreak can be triggered by certain stimuli, such as:<br />\n<br />\nstress<br />\nmenstrual periods<br />\nfever or illness<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Encephalitis\nwas a rare disease, --not any more !</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Primary encephalitis\ncan occur as a late consequence of a viral infection. The best known types\nare&nbsp; HIV-associated encephalopathy and\ndementia ( myelin sheaths damaged )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In acute encephalitis,\ninflammation and edema occur in infected areas throughout the cerebral\nhemispheres, brain stem, cerebellum, and, occasionally, spinal cord. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Direct viral invasion\nof the brain usually damages neurons, sometimes producing microscopically\nvisible inclusion bodies. Severe infection, particularly untreated HSV\nencephalitis, can cause brain hemorrhagic necrosis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Acute disseminated\nencephalomyelitis is characterized by multifocal areas of perivenous\ndemyelination and absence of virus in the brain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Symptoms include fever,\nheadache, and altered mental status, often accompanied by seizures and focal\nneurologic deficits<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Olfactory seizures,\nmanifested as an aura of foul smells (rotten eggs, burnt meat), indicate\ntemporal lobe involvement and suggest HSV ( Herpes Simples Virus )\nencephalitis.</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Herpes simplex viruses\nbelong to a group of viruses called the human herpes viruses. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other members of the\ngroup include:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Varicella zoster virus\n(VZV) which is the cause of chickenpox and shingles.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Epstein-Barr virus\n(EBV) which is the cause of glandular fever.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cytomegalovirus (CMV),\noccasionally causing a glandular-fever-like illness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other more recently\ndescribed human herpes viruses: human herpes viruses 6, 7 and 8 (HHV 6, 7,\n&amp; 8). The role of these viruses in causation of human diseases is not, as\nyet, fully explained.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Infection of the mouth\nand throat with herpes simplex virus type 1 (HSV 1) usually occurs early in\nlife often without symptoms. The virus attaches to, and enters sensory nerves\nin the throat and moves to nerve cells called \u2018ganglia\u2019 (e.g. the trigeminal\nganglia).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here the virus establishes a latent and life-long infection. Because\nmost individuals are infected with the virus early in life this means that, a\nhigh proportion of the population carry HSV 1 in latent form and they are\ninfected for life. In some people from time to time, the virus may reactivate\nto produce recognisable lesions such as cold sores around the lips and nose.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Herpes simplex virus\nencephalitis (HSE) happens when HSV enters the brain. It occurs at any age, to\neither sex and at any time of year.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the west THOUSANDS\nof cases are recorded&nbsp; per annum\u2014they\nkeep this a secret.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Herpes simplex (HSV)\nvirus causes cold sores of the mouth and lesions of the genitals. HSV is\ntransmitted directly through human contact. Newborns can also get the virus by\npassing through an infected birth canal.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once inside the body, the virus\ntravels through nerve fibers and can cause an infection of the brain. The virus\nmay also undergo a period of latency in which it is inactive.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At a later time,\nemotional or physical stress can reactivate the virus to cause an infection of\nthe brain. It causes the most subacute (between acute and chronic) and chronic\n(lasting three or more months) encephalitis infections in humans.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The most common virus\nthat causes encephalitis in developed countries is herpes simplex. The herpes\nvirus typically travels through a nerve to the skin, where it causes a cold\nsore. In rare cases, however, the virus goes to the brain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>I TELL MY ELDER SON TO\nWASH HIS HANDS WITH SOAP EVERY TIME HE COMES OUT OF THE GYM &nbsp;OR WINDOWLESS OFFICE ROOMS / TOILETS WHICH DO\nNOT GET DIRECT SUNLIGHT<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Encephalitis caused by\nviruses in the United States generally fall into the following groups:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arboviruses are the\nprimary cause of acute encephalitis (sudden-onset encephalitis caused by direct\ninfection). Arboviruses, short for \"arthropod-borne viruses,\" are\nspread by mosquitoes and ticks..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Herpes viruses are the\nother major cause of encephalitis in the U.S. This virus family includes herpes\nsimplex, Epstein-Barr, cytomegalovirus, and varicella-zoster.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Enteroviruses , such as\ncoxsackievirus, are viruses that enter the body through the gastrointestinal\ntract.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In EXTREMELY rare\ncases, secondary encephalitis can develop following childhood viral diseases\nsuch as measles, mumps, and rubella.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">EVIL PHARMA spends\nmillions of USD every year to shout from the roof tops that &nbsp;diphtheria-pertussis-tetanus and\nmeasles-mumps-rubella vaccines do NOT cause encephalitis, and their research guarantees\n100% that these childhood vaccines are very safe and do not increase\nencephalitis risk. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">They have their agent doctors\nall over the planet to second this declaration\u2014what they do NOT say is these bribed\ndoctors are also send on sexual jaunts abroad ( &nbsp;pedophila ).</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the west people\nallow their pets to sleep on their beds .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Encephalitis from toxoplasmosis, which can be transmitted through a pets's\nfeces or by eating contaminated food, rivals herpes as the most common\ninfectious cause of encephalitis<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Symptoms of\nencephalitis usually appear within 2 days to 2 weeks of exposure to the virus.\nIn milder cases, symptoms may resemble the flu. In severe cases of full-blown\nencephalitis, symptoms may include:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Behavioral and\npersonality changes<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Sensitivity to light<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Fever<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Headache<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Vomiting<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Lethargy and reduced\nconsciousness<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Memory loss<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Stiff neck and back --\naccompanied by fever and headache would indicate meningitis<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Confusion<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Speech, hearing, and\nvision problems<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Muscle weakness<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Seizures<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Partial paralysis<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Loss of consciousness</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Coma</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When encephalitis is\nsuspected, a sample of cerebrospinal fluid is taken using a lumbar puncture,\nwhich involves inserting a needle between two vertebrae in the patient's lower\nback. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sample is taken to\ncount white blood cells and identify specific blood cell types, to measure\nproteins and blood sugar levels, and to determine spinal fluid pressure. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Doctors use\ncerebrospinal fluid to test for herpes simplex virus, Epstein-Barr virus,\nvaricella-zoster virus, enteroviruses, and to look for the presence of\nantibodies to the West Nile virus. While cerebrospinal fluid tests may help\ndiagnose encephalitis, they cannot provide information on how severe the\ndisease will be.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cerebrospinal fluid\n(CSF) is a clear, colorless body fluid found in the brain and spine. The brain\nproduces roughly 500 mL of cerebrospinal fluid per day. This transcellular\nfluid is constantly reabsorbed, so that only 100\u2013160 mL is present at any one\ntime.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lumbar puncture is carried out under sterile conditions by inserting a\nneedle into the subarachnoid space, usually between the third and fourth lumbar\nvertebrae. CSF is extracted through the needle, and tested.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cells in the fluid\nare counted, as are the levels of protein and glucose. These parameters alone\nmay be extremely beneficial in the diagnosis of subarachnoid hemorrhage and\ncentral nervous system infections.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A large volume lumbar\npuncture is a special kind of lumbar puncture (spinal tap) specifically\nintended to remove 40 ml of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) to both assess and\ntemporarily relieve symptoms of hydrocephalus.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cerebrospinal fluid is a clear\nfluid that acts as a cushion for the brain and maintains overall central\nnervous system homeostasis. &nbsp;&nbsp;CSF acts as\na cushion or buffer for the cortex, providing a basic mechanical and\nimmunological protection to the brain inside the skull and serving a vital\nfunction in cerebral autoregulation of cerebral blood flow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;CSF serves five primary purposes: buoyancy,\nprotection, chemical stability, waste removal, and prevention of brain\nischemia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Analysis of CSF for\nthree protein biomarkers can indicate the presence of Alzheimer's disease. The\nthree biomarkers are CSF amyloid beta 1-42, total CSF tau protein, and\nP-Tau181P.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The actual mass of the\nhuman brain is about 1400 grams; however, the net weight of the brain suspended\nin the CSF is equivalent to a mass of 25 grams. The brain therefore exists in\nneutral buoyancy, which allows the brain to maintain its density without being\nimpaired by its own weight. CSF protects the brain tissue from injury when\njolted or hit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CSF flows throughout\nthe inner ventricular system in the brain and is absorbed back into the\nbloodstream, rinsing the metabolic waste from the central nervous system (CNS) through\nthe blood-brain barrier.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When CSF pressure is\nelevated, cerebral blood flow may be constricted. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lumbar puncture is\nperformed in an attempt to count the cells in the fluid and to detect the\nlevels of protein and glucose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These parameters alone\nmay be extremely beneficial in the diagnosis of subarachnoid hemorrhage and CNS\ninfections such as meningitis. Moreover, a CSF culture examination may yield\nthe microorganism that has caused the infection...<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The polymerase chain\nreaction (PCR) is very sensitive at detecting low levels of viruses\u2019 genetic\nfingerprints</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TODAY DOCTORS IN INDIA\nREMOVE SPINAL FLUID FROM SMALL INDIAN CHILDREN ( EXTREMELY PAINFUL ) EVEN IF\nTHEY HAVE A SIMPLE FEVER \u2013 &nbsp;QUOTING TEST\nIS REQUIRED FOR MENINGITIS BLAH BLAH&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THIS IS A FOUL SCAM, I WILL\nSOON POST ON IT--GATHERING INFO<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With the exception of\nherpes simplex and varicella-zoster encephalitis, the viral forms of\nencephalitis are not treatable. It is very important to lower fever and ease\nthe pressure caused by swelling of the brain.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patients with very severe\nencephalitis are at risk for body-wide (systemic) complications including\nshock, low oxygen, low blood pressure, and low sodium levels.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Encephalitis is\nsuspected in patients with unexplained alterations in mental status. Clinical\npresentation and differential diagnoses may suggest certain diagnostic tests,\nbut MRI and CSF analysis (including PCR for HSV and other viruses) are usually\ndone, typically with other tests (eg, serologic tests) to identify the\ncausative virus. Despite extensive testing, the cause of many cases of\nencephalitis remains unknown<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anti-NMDA receptor\nencephalitis is a disease occurring when antibodies produced by the body\u2019s own\nimmune system attack NMDA receptors in the brain. NMDA receptors are proteins\nthat control electrical impulses in the brain. Their functions are critical for\njudgement, perception of reality, human interaction, the formation and\nretrieval of memory, and the control of unconscious activities (such as\nbreathing, swallowing, etc), also known as autonomic functions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Antibodies are an\nimportant part of the body\u2019s defense system. All healthy individuals produce\nantibodies against viruses, bacteria or tumours.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Under normal circumstances,\nthe body prevents production of antibodies against its own (\u2018host\u2019) tissues. In\nsome individuals, however, antibodies that target the host may be produced.\nWhen this occurs the patient is said to have an \u201cauto immune\u201d (i.e.,\noriginating from one\u2019s self) disease.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In anti-NMDA receptor\nencephalitis antibodies are generated against NMDA receptors and go on to\nattack these receptors where they are found in their highest concentration:\nwithin the brain. The reasons why anti-NMDA receptor antibodies are formed is\nnot yet fully understood.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anti-NMDA receptor\nencephalitis may be associated with a tumour, and may therefore be referred to\nas a \u201cpara (i.e., associated with) neo (i.e., new) plastic (i.e., growth\u201d)\ndisease. If a tumour is found, it is most often a benign (i.e., not cancerous)\ntumour of the ovary.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The most common tumour type is a teratoma. However, unlike\nother tumours, it may contain many different types of body tissues (including\nbrain tissue!)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most tumours associated\nwith anti-NMDA receptor encephalitis contain neural tissue (tissue containing\ncells identical to that found in the brain), and NMDA receptors.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is presumed\nthat antibodies are initially formed against NMDA receptors found within\ntumours, and then attack similar-looking receptors in the brain producing the\nsymptoms and signs associated with anti-NMDA receptor encephalitis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tumour removal is a\nvery important part of treatment.. Patients who have a tumour that is removed,\nrecover faster and are less likely to experience a recurrence (or relapse) of\ntheir disease than those in whom no tumour is found.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All patients suspected of\nsuffering from anti-NMDA receptor encephalitis should be screened for the\npresence of tumours. This is usually done with imaging (CT or MRI) of the\nchest, abdomen and pelvis.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Women should also receive an ultrasound of the\novaries, and men should receive an ultrasound of the testes. Even after\nremoval, tumours can regrow. Therefore, people with anti-NMDA receptor\nencephalitis should be checked periodically for the presence (or recurrence) of\ntumours.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In many people with\nanti-NMDA receptor encephalitis a tumour is never found. This may be because\nthe tumour is too small to detect with imaging techniques, or because it has\nbeen destroyed by the immune system, or there is no tumour. In cases not\nassociated with a tumour, it is not known what causes anti-NMDA receptor\nencephalitis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A diagnosis of\nanti-NMDA receptor encephalitis requires antibodies to be detected in the body\nfluids of someone with symptoms consistent with anti-NMDA receptor\nencephalitis. Antibodies may be found in either blood or spinal fluid.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tests on\nthe spinal fluid are more accurate than those on the blood. Therefore, if blood\ntests are negative, the spinal fluid should be tested before concluding that\nthe patient does not have anti-NMDA receptor encephalitis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Imaging is an important\npart of the evaluation of a patient with suspected anti-NMDA receptor\nencephalitis, and should include studies looking at the brain (MRI) and studies\nlooking at the body for an associated tumour.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although anti-NMDA\nreceptor encephalitis is a serious life-threatening disease, the majority of\npatients who receive prompt diagnosis and treatment go on to make a good\nrecovery.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Recovery is generally\nslow and may occur over months or even years. The recovery process is often\ncomplicated by many ups and downs, and by fears of relapse or re-emergence of\nsymptoms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Anti-N-methyl-d-aspartate\n(Anti-NMDA) receptor encephalitis is an acute autoimmune neurological disorder.\nThe cause of this disease is often related to vaccines . &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Nobody will admit it\u2014such is the power of\nEVIL PHARMA<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Acute disseminated\nencephalomyelitis (ADEM) is characterized by a brief but intense attack of\ninflammation in the brain and spinal cord that damages myelin.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vaccination can trigger\nADEM. ADEM is sometimes diagnosed as a severe first attack of multiple\nsclerosis (MS) since some of the symptoms of the two disorders, particularly\nthose caused by demyelination, overlap.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, ADEM usually\nhas symptoms of encephalitis (such as fever or coma), as well as symptoms of\nmyelin damage (visual loss, paralysis), as opposed to MS, which usually doesn\u2019t\nhave encephalitis-like symptoms. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In addition, ADEM\nusually consists of a single episode or attack, while MS features many attacks\nover the course of time.&nbsp; MS, like ADEM,\ncan also be triggered by viral infection or vaccination.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>IN USA EVIL PHARMA HAS\nTHEIR OWN LAWYERS AND JUDGES TO SETTLE VACCINE CAUSED ADEM OUTSIDE COURTS BY\nBRIBES .<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Serious adverse\nreactions to the flu vaccine are rarely, if at all, discussed<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A lifelong disabling\nreaction to flu vaccine includes sudden onset illnesses that effect the nervous\nsystem\u2013particularly &nbsp;CIDP (Chronic\nInflammatory Demyelinating Polyneuropathy), and acute disseminated\nencephalomyelitis (ADEM).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Doctors in the payroll\nof EVIL PHARMA dismiss the appearance of a reaction to flu vaccine as it\ndevelops over the weeks after receiving flu shot.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Guillain-Barre syndrome\nis a &nbsp;serious autoimmune disease\ninvolving the nervous system<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Guillain-Barre syndrome\nis an autoimmune disease<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Autoimmune diseases are\nwhere an individual's immune system destroys healthy tissue<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The initial symptoms of\nGuillain-Barre syndrome are tingling and muscle weakness. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Eventually, the entire\nbody can become paralyzed.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the case of\nGuillain-Barre syndrome, it is the myelin sheaths of peripheral nerves that are\nthe targets of the autoimmune response.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In some cases, the\nnerve axons are also attacked - these are the long, thin extensions of nerve\ncells.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the myelin is slowly\nremoved, nerves can no longer transmit information such as touch sensations to\nthe brain, hence the numbness. In addition, the brain is no longer able to\ntransmit signals back to the body; this explains the muscle weakness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The disease normally\nbegins as a tingling sensation and weakness in the extremities - often the feet\nand legs - slowly spreading until a large portion of the body is affected. This\nis because the nerves running to the lower extremities are the longest in the\nbody and, therefore, easier to attack and compromise.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Guillain-Barre syndrome\nis considered an emergency and should be treated by medical professionals as\nsoon as possible.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Recovery from\nGuillain-Barre syndrome can be very slow, needing a lot of support,\nphysiotherapy, counseling and occupational therapy. A few patients, sadly, are\nleft with long term disability. Around 80% of patients can walk within 6\nmonths, 60% fully recover strength within 1 year and 5-10% have incomplete or\ndelayed recovery.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Eating processed foods &nbsp;may weaken the intestines in a way that raises\nthe risk for autoimmune diseases, such as type 1 diabetes, celiac disease and\nmultiple sclerosis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Complications of\nencephalitis can include epilepsy and memory loss.. Encephalitis occurs in 1 in\nevery 1,000 cases of measles.. Encephalitis generally begins with fever ,headache\nand photophobia (excessive sensitivity to light)..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The individual may also\nexperience nuchal rigidity (neck stiffness), which can lead to a MISDIAGNOSIS of\nmeningitis. There may be stiffness of the limbs, slow movements, and\nclumsiness.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In more serious cases, the person may experience very severe\nheadaches, nausea, vomiting, confusion, disorientation, memory loss, speech\nproblems, hearing problems, hallucinations, as well as seizures and possibly\ncoma. In some cases, the patient can become aggressive.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The symptoms rapidly worsen, and there may be\nseizures (fits), confusion, drowsiness, and loss of consciousness, and even\ncoma. &nbsp;&nbsp;Again, when there is direct viral\ninfection of the brain or spinal cord, it is called primary encephalitis.\nSecondary encephalitis refers to an infection which started off elsewhere in\nthe body and then spread to the brain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Encephalitis can\ndevelop as a result of a direct infection to the brain by a virus, bacterium,\nor fungus<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Initially, encephalitis\nis harder to detect in young children and babies. Parents or guardians should\nlook out for vomiting, a bulging fontanel (the soft area on the top center of\nthe head), incessant crying that does not get better when the baby is picked up\nand comforted, and body stiffness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Primary (infectious)\nencephalitis can be split into three main categories of viruses:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Common viruses -\nincluding HSV (herpes simplex virus) and EBV (Epstein-Barr virus)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Childhood viruses -\nincluding measles and mumps<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arboviruses (spread by\nmosquitoes, ticks, and other insects) - including Japanese encephalitis, West\nNile encephalitis, and tick-borne encephalitis<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Secondary\n(post-infectious) encephalitis: could be caused by a complication of a viral\ninfection. Symptoms start to appear days or even weeks after the initial\ninfection. The patient's immune system treats healthy brain cells as foreign\norganisms and attacks them. We still do not know why the immune system\nmalfunctions in this way. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In more than 50 percent\nof encephalitis cases, the exact cause of the illness is not tracked down.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A lumbar puncture,\nwhich takes a sample of cerebrospinal fluid from the spine, might reveal\nhigher-than-normal levels of protein and white blood cells. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, this test is\nnot always conclusive, in some cases, the results may come back normal even\nthough the patient has encephalitis. An MRI is the best imaging option for\nencephalitis; it can identify the classic brain changes that suggest\nencephalitis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An EEG\n(electroencephalograph) that monitors the electrical activity of the brain may\nshow sharp waves in one or both of the temporal lobes in patients with encephalitis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Complications may\ninclude:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Loss of memory -\nespecially among those who had herpes simplex virus encephalitis<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Behavioral or\npersonality changes - such as mood swings, bouts of frustration and anger, and\nanxiety<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Epilepsy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aphasia - language and\nspeech problems<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://paraven.net/us-vaccine-court-awards-damages-for-brain-injuries-from-gardasil-vaccine/\"><span style=\"background-color: lime; font-size: large;\">http://paraven.net/us-vaccine-court-awards-damages-for-brain-injuries-from-gardasil-vaccine/</span></a><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the United States,\nthere are five main encephalitis-causing viruses spread by mosquitoes: West\nNile, Eastern equine encephalitis (EEE), Western equine encephalitis (WEE), La\nCrosse, and St. Louis encephalitis. Two types of Powassan viruses, an\ninfrequent cause of encephalitis, are transmitted by at least two types of\nticks.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Japanese encephalitis\nvirus is the most common arbovirus in the world (virus transmitted by\nblood-sucking mosquitoes or ticks) and is responsible for 50,000 cases and\n15,000 deaths per year worldwide.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The immune system\nprotects the body from illness and infection. When germs enter the body, the\nimmune system attacks them to stop them causing a serious infection.&nbsp;&nbsp; But very rarely something goes wrong with\nthe immune system and it mistakenly attacks the brain, causing encephalitis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some Japanese who ate\nIndian INA soldiers ( 21,000 ) at the Island of Rabaul developed encephalitis.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This was kept as a great secret.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The local who ate the\ndiscards due to &nbsp;lack of edible food &nbsp;&nbsp;got\nKURU-- an incurable neurodegenerative disorder. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The brains of the Indians soldiers were discarded\nby the Japanese<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kuru is caused by the\ntransmission of abnormally folded prion proteins, which leads to symptoms such\nas tremors, loss of coordination, and neurodegeneration.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kuru\u2019s long incubation\nperiod of anywhere from 12 to over 50 years<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/netaji-subhash-chandra-bose-untold.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/netaji-subhash-chandra-bose-untold.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE WHITE MAN IS\nNEARING THE END OF THE INCUBATION PERIOD FOR VARIANT CREUTZFELDT JACOB DISEASE &nbsp;( FEEDING COWS WITH COW MEAT \u2013CANNIBALISM ) &nbsp;AND THEY ARE DESPERATE.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Phillipines people\nwho eat too much pork giblets ( rare ) get Encephalitis</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/09/of-pork-and-pigs-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/09/of-pork-and-pigs-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Autoimmune encephalitis is where after VACCINATION the body\u2019s\nimmune system attacks the layers of tissue that wrap around nerve fibers (called\nthe myelin sheath) in the brain and spinal cord. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The attack occurs because proteins in myelin resemble those in the\nvirus. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">EVIL PHARMA uses this for depopulation and reducing the BRAIN\nPOWER of third world nations . They bribe the authorities to use Indians as\nguinea &nbsp;pigs\u2026</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/05/guinea-pigs-for-untested-medicines.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/05/guinea-pigs-for-untested-medicines.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a result, nerve\ntransmission becomes very slow. The resulting disorder, called acute\ndisseminated encephalomyelitis, resembles multiple sclerosis except that\nsymptoms do not come and go as they do in multiple sclerosis. The viruses most\noften involved include enteroviruses, Epstein-Barr virus, hepatitis A or B\nvirus, human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), and influenza viruses.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An autoimmune\nencephalitis may also develop if the immune system produces antibodies that\nattack proteins on the surface of nerve cells called N-methyl-d-aspartate\n(NMDA) receptors.&nbsp; The resulting\nencephalitis is called anti-NMDA receptor encephalitis.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anti-NMDA receptor\nencephalitis is a more common type of encephalitis .. EVIL PHARMA bribes to\nkeep this a secret.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HIV-associated encephalopathy\ncan cause gradual personality changes, problems with coordination, and\ndementia.&nbsp; If the spinal cord is\naffected, parts of the body may feel numb and weak.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Which parts are affected\ndepend on which parts of the spinal cord are affected .&nbsp; People may have difficulty controlling\nbladder and bowel function. If the infection is severe, people may lose\nsensation, become paralyzed, and lose control of the bladder and bowels.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Long after a case of measles or chickenpox,\nthe virus can be reactivated and cause inflammation in the brain.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
